intro: Psychotria breteleri, commonly known as the Breteler's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and produces small, white to pale green flowers. It is often found growing in shaded, humid environments within tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
